subject: College Athletics
Soccer
lead_paragraph: The junior midfielder Edel Malone and goalkeeper Krystal Robens carried Hofstra to a 1-0 victory over Ohio State yesterday in the opening round of the N.C.A.A. tournament at Penn State’s Jeffrey Field. Robens set university records with her seventh consecutive shutout and 12th of the season in the Pride’s first N.C.A.A. tournament victory. Hofstra (18-3) will face top-seeded Penn State tomorrow.The Pride scored 7 minutes 38 seconds into the second half when the freshman forward Kayla Pifer sent a low cross through the middle, where Malone was waiting at the far post.
